name: Great Acting Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Charles Laughton did an outstanding job as Captain Bligh in the best version of 'Mutiny on the Bounty'. Gable played Fletcher Christian; who was the other star of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Franchot Tone.

	'But you're taking my ship!' Great performance.

questions.text: Peter O'Toole was very solid in 'Becket', but he didn't play the title character. Who did?
questions.explanation:
Richard Burton.

	O'Toole wasn't bad in 'Lawrence of Arabia', either.

questions.text: Laurence Olivier was excellent in 'Spartacus'. Which of the following was NOT in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Rod Steiger.

	Ustinov won the Oscar. Strode was a gladiator. Gavin played Julius Caesar.

questions.text: Malcolm McDowell was outstanding in 'A Clockwork Orange'. Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
Anthony Burgess.

	He did a heckuva job.

questions.text: Spencer Tracy was brilliant in 'Inherit the Wind'. Who was his talented adversary?
questions.explanation:
Fredric March.

	Clarence Darrow vs. William Jennings Bryan. Intersting supporting cast: Claude Akins, Dick York, Harry Morgan.

questions.text: Raymond Massey nailed it when he played Lincoln in 'Abe Lincoln in Illinois'. Which of the following was NOT in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Anne Baxter.

	Lockhart was Stephen Douglas. Gordon played Mary Todd. Da Silva was onre of the local townspeople.

questions.text: Montgomery Clift was superb in 'From Here to Eternity'. How did his character (Prewitt) get into the trouble that ultimately cost him his life?
options: He got involved with a questionable woman
questions.explanation:
He killed a soldier.

	Sinatra (Maggio) walked off guard - not Clift. Clift's drinking and socializing did not lead to trouble, but his killing of Sergeant Judson (Borgnine) sealed his fate.

questions.text: Jack Lemmon had his best dramatic role with his first dramatic starring role in 'Days of Wine and Roses'. Who played his troubled father-in-law?
questions.explanation:
Charles Bickford.

	Outstanding job. Klugman played an AA member.

questions.text: Alastair Sim was wonderful in the best version (in my opinion) of 'A Christmas Carol'. Who wrote it?
Stage actor F. Murray Abraham turned in a top performance in 'Amadeus'. Who played the title role?
questions.explanation:
Tom Hulce.

	A fine job by Hulce as Mozart, but Abraham had the meatier role.
